Crypto Fear Hits Extreme Levels as Bitcoin Dips Below $65,000

EN

The Crypto Fear and Greed Index has fallen to extreme fear levels of 5-9, the lowest since the June 2022 Terra and FTX crashes. This comes as Bitcoin briefly dropped below $65,000, showing a single-day decline of over $10,000 and triggering widespread liquidations in the market. U.S. spot Bitcoin ETFs recorded $434.1 million in net outflows on February 5, with BlackRock's IBIT leading the outflows. This reflects growing caution among institutional investors as market sentiment reaches extreme fear territory.

Key Points

  • Crypto Fear and Greed Index reaches extreme fear levels of 5-9
  • Bitcoin briefly drops below $65,000 with over $10,000 single-day decline
  • U.S. spot Bitcoin ETFs see $434.1 million in net outflows
  • Institutional investors showing growing caution

Article

The Crypto Fear and Greed Index fell to extreme fear levels of 5-9, the lowest since the June 2022 Terra and FTX crashes, as Bitcoin briefly dropped below $65,000 before recovering. The cryptocurrency saw a single-day decline of over $10,000, wiping out significant market value and triggering widespread liquidations. U.S. spot Bitcoin ETFs recorded $434.1 million in net outflows on February 5, led by BlackRock‚Äôs IBIT, reflecting growing caution among institutional investors.
